intro: Galium sylvaticum var. typicum, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Galium sylvaticum var. typicum is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
